name: OpenAI OpenAPI Spec (YAML)
snippet:
-title: OpenAI API
-description: The OpenAI REST API. Please see https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference for more details.
-version: 2.3.0
-termsOfService: https://openai.com/policies/terms-of-use
-contact:
-name: OpenAI Support
-url: https://help.openai.com/
-license:
-name: MIT
-url: https://github.com/openai/openai-openapi/blob/master/LICENSE
+  title: OpenAI API
+  description: The OpenAI REST API. Please see https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference for more details.
+  version: 2.3.0
+  termsOfService: https://openai.com/policies/terms-of-use
+  contact:
+    name: OpenAI Support
+    url: https://help.openai.com/
+  license:
+    name: MIT
+    url: https://github.com/openai/openai-openapi/blob/master/LICENSE
+  - url: https://api.openai.com/v1
+  - ApiKeyAuth: []
-description: Build Assistants that can call models and use tools.
-description: Turn audio into text or text into audio.
-description: Given a list of messages comprising a conversation, the model will return a response.
-description: Manage conversations and conversation items.
-description: >-
-Given a prompt, the model will return one or more predicted completions, and can also return the
-probabilities of alternative tokens at each position.
-description: >-
-Get a vector representation of a given input that can be easily consumed by machine learning models and
-algorithms.
-description: Manage and run evals in the OpenAI platform.
-description: Manage fine-tuning jobs to tailor a model to your specific training data.
-description: Manage and run graders in the OpenAI platform.
-description: Create large batches of API requests to run asynchronously.
-description: Files are used to upload documents that can be used with features like Assistants and Fine-tuning.
-description: Use Uploads to upload large files in multiple parts.
-description: Given a prompt and/or an input image, the model will generate a new image.
-description: List and describe the various models available in the API.

name: OpenAI Developer Changelog (RSS)
snippet:
-Developer changelog -Track new docs, product features, and fixes across OpenAI's developer platform in one changelog. -https://developers.openai.com/ -Team Config for shared configuration -https://developers.openai.com/changelog/#codex-2026-01-23-mdx -https://developers.openai.com/changelog/#codex-2026-01-23-mdx -Team Config for shared configuration -Fri, 23 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT -# Team Config for shared configuration +Developer changelog< + + + + -Learn more in [Team Config](/codex/team-config). -Custom prompts deprecated -https://developers.openai.com/changelog/#codex-2026-01-22-mdx -https://developers.openai.com/changelog/#codex-2026-01-22-mdx -Custom prompts deprecated -Thu, 22 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT -# Custom prompts deprecated -Custom prompts are now deprecated. Use [skills](/codex/skills) for reusable instructions and workflows instead. -Expanded llms.txt coverage -https://developers.openai.com/changelog/#developers-2026-01-22-mdx -https://developers.openai.com/changelog/#developers-2026-01-22-mdx -Expanded llms.txt coverage to include resources, blog posts, cookbook entries, and the developer changelog, with full exports where available. -Thu, 22 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT -# Expanded llms.txt coverage -## Fixes & improvements -Codex CLI Release: 0.89.0 -https://developers.openai.com/changelog/#github-release-279171728 -https://developers.openai.com/changelog/#github-release-279171728 -0.89.0 -Thu, 22 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT -

New Features

-
    -
  • Added a /permissions command with a shorter approval set while keeping /approvals for compatibility. (App server now supports thread/read and can filter archived threads in thread/list. (
